title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
desc: Could you survive on your own, in the wild, with everyone out to make sure you don't live to see the morning?

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: There is a door at the end of a silent corridor. And it’s haunting Harry Potter’s dreams.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
desc: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
desc: Since its immediate success in 1813, Pride and Prejudice has remained one of the most popular novels in the English language.

title: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
desc: Deeply seductive and extraordinarily suspenseful, Twilight is a love story with bite.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
desc: It is 1939. Nazi Germany. The country is holding its breath. Death has never been busier, and will be busier still.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
desc: George Orwell's timeless and timely allegorical novel—a scathing satire on a downtrodden society’s blind march towards totalitarianism.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Journeys to the end of the world, fantastic creatures, and epic battles between good and evil—what more could any reader ask for in one book?

title: The Hobbit (Middle-earth Universe)
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. It was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
desc: Margaret Mitchell's monumental epic of the South won a Pulitzer Prize, gave rise to the most popular motion picture of our time.
